text: Apologies for the delay in getting back Johnny hope you had a lovely weekend! I only recently learned substance on my internship, I made a security camera asset for a live action short film, so I learned the basics of PBR shading through that. Substance painter is definitely something I want to get using in my modeling workflow from now on, it’s amazing! Would that be what the texture artists in DNEG use?

Good morning ! Don’t worry when you get back me ,it’s whenever it’s better to you . 
I would like to see more of your work and specially WIP , any changes you can set a google drive or any place you can store your work for me to have a look? 
Can you tell me your current workflow ? From model to render ? 
Substance painter and also designer is a good part of the workflow we use . Also Mari until painter becomes stronger

Sure! I can set up one tonight and put up what I have, I’ll link it to you when it’s sorted. 
At home, I mainly use Maya for modeling and photoshop for painting textures, and I render through Arnold. I also try to use Unity if it’s an asset I want to implement into a game, to see how it renders in real time. I’ve been practicing ZBrush in my own time when I can.
In my internship I’ve been working in Maya for making the assets, Substance painter, then Redshift in Maya for rendering and Nuke.
